left_knee_angle.title: Proper Knee Bend
left_knee_angle.tip: Keep knees bent 110-170° for stability. Avoid locking out or over-bending.

right_knee_angle.title: Proper Knee Bend
right_knee_angle.tip: Keep knees bent 110-170° for stability. Avoid locking out or over-bending.

left_hip_angle.title: Hip Hinge Position
left_hip_angle.tip: Maintain 90-170° hip angle. Don't fold forward at the waist.

right_hip_angle.title: Hip Hinge Position
right_hip_angle.tip: Maintain 90-170° hip angle. Don't fold forward at the waist.

left_elbow_angle.title: Relaxed Arms
left_elbow_angle.tip: Keep elbows soft (100-180°). Tense arms reduce balance.

right_elbow_angle.title: Relaxed Arms
right_elbow_angle.tip: Keep elbows soft (100-180°). Tense arms reduce balance.

left_arm_raise.title: Arm Position for Balance
left_arm_raise.tip: Arms at 20-120° from body. Use for balance, not overhead.

right_arm_raise.title: Arm Position for Balance
right_arm_raise.tip: Arms at 20-120° from body. Use for balance, not overhead.

shoulder_tilt.title: Level Shoulders
shoulder_tilt.tip: Keep shoulders roughly horizontal (70-110°). Excessive tilt indicates imbalance.

spinal_angle.title: Upright Posture
spinal_angle.tip: Stay within 0-35° from vertical. Excessive forward lean reduces control.

head_forward_offset.title: Head Position
head_forward_offset.tip: Keep head centered over shoulders. Forward head position affects balance.

stance_width_ratio.title: Stance Width
stance_width_ratio.tip: Feet 1.5-3x hip width apart. Too narrow = unstable. Too wide = restricted.
